Member Function Documentation

void FT::CCKRestartLocalController::call ( Net::CallStack *  cc  )  [protected, virtual]

Entry point for a service. Derived user service may implement this method.

This method is deprecated.

A network implantation calls this method if message arrives. The call should neither be q blocking call, neither post message to network, else deadlock may appears depending on the concret network implantation. Please read the feature list about such a specific implantation.

This method is called for the AM, WS, and AWS protocols when all data of the message have been received (both immediate and defered data). The CallStack have public fields that should be used to unpack or get data, or to access to the status of the message. All exception throws by the call to this method are catched to report a service call error into all network implementation.

Parameters:
cc (IN) the call context
See also:
CallStack

Reimplemented from Net::Service.

void FT::CCKRestartLocalController::run (  )  [virtual]

Entry point executed by new started thread of control. This method is call when a new thread of control has been sucessfully created and started. Because a new thread cannot be join (as Posix do), no return value are required. Passing parameters to the thread reported to object creation of a derived class from Thread class.

Implements Util::Thread.
